intro: Schwartzia chocoensis, commonly known as the Chocoan hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to deep red. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in lowland forests. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for ecological studies and potential ornamental use.
